titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts 1977.572
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally rocessed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-12 14:47:28 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts
did.abstract: Receipts dated 1892 to 1897 and issued by the Queens County Treasurer's Office from a public auction for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County owned by Charles H. Smith and seized for non-payment of taxes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts, 1977.572, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original and Photostat copies of receipts issued by the Queens County Treasurer's Office from a public auction for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County owned by Charles H. Smith and seized for non-payment of taxes. The receipts date from 1892 to 1897.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
